channel.title: How to make my server?
channel.description: Okai, I'm new to this site, and I wanted to make a server of my own. Nothing wrong so far. I made my own host on the no-ip.org site and everything, I downloaded the DUC v2.2.1, clicked the checkmark next to the host name, so that should mean it's online. I go to register server, type in the name OblivScape (that's the name of what my server will be) then put in the IP, port 43594 and the version 317. I click Register Server, then it says "The server OblivScape is offline, it must be online before you can register it here." What am I doing wrong?!

item.title: How to make my server?
item.dc:creator: @Fireweaver0 Fireweaver0
item.description:
@Fireweaver0 wrote:

I was being mean?
No i was being sarcastic not necessarily mean.
If i was being mean i certainly would not have provided a link to a portforwarding guide.

New members can try searching before making topics.
Plus portforwarding topics are not allowed, if talk continues about portforwarding it will get locked.

Read full topic

item.title: How to make my server?
item.dc:creator: @gunz4life gunz4life
item.description:
@gunz4life wrote:

[quote=“Fireweaver0, post:6, topic:289733”]Welcome to the wonderful world of Searching…

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,372707.0.html[/quote]
Don’t have to be mean to new people, i doubt you’ll like it. You must have a router to portfoward, do you have a router?

Read full topic

item.title: How to make my server?
item.dc:creator: @cooljay1000 cooljay1000
item.description:
@cooljay1000 wrote:

Ok, so I’m reading the tutorial. I did everything right up to portforwarding. I’m stuck up to the internet broswer thing? “You can find your default gateway if you scroll down, so once you have done that, open up your internet browser and type it in.” That’s where it gets complicated. Does that mean I should pull up my firefox and type in the default gateway? If so, where? OR is it because I have Vista? I’m confused =S

Read full topic

item.title: How to make my server?
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

Lol. Just becuase you put the check in the box doesn’t mean it is online. You have to run it, and make sure you portforwarded right.

Read full topic

Okai, I’m new to this site, and I wanted to make a server of my own. Nothing wrong so far. I made my own host on the no-ip.org site and everything, I downloaded the DUC v2.2.1, clicked the checkmark next to the host name, so that should mean it’s online. I go to register server, type in the name OblivScape (that’s the name of what my server will be) then put in the IP, port 43594 and the version 317. I click Register Server, then it says “The server OblivScape is offline, it must be online before you can register it here.” What am I doing wrong?!
